You said:
i still not slove the problem of how i can get data of GMP and subscrpiton
ChatGPT said:

Got it this is the biggest missing piece in OpenIPO:
GMP (Grey Market Premium) data
Live subscription (QIB / NII / Retail) data

And yes this is hard because SEBI / NSE / BSE do not provide GMP officially and subscription data is not provided via a clean public API.

So you have only 3 real-world working options, and Ill tell you the best one for your project.

1) GMP Data How to Get it (Realistic Options)

Option A (Best): Use a trusted GMP data provider API

Some IPO data providers give GMP via API (paid/free tiers).
Your backend will fetch:

  • IPO name / slug

  • GMP price

  • Kostak rate

  • Subject to Sauda (optional)

  • last updated time

Pros:

  • Most accurate + stable

  • Easy to integrate

  • No scraping headache

Cons:

  • Mostly paid

Best for premium product like OpenIPO.

Option B: Web scraping GMP sites (works but risky)

You scrape websites which publish GMP daily.

Pros:

  • Cheap / free

  • Possible quickly

Cons:

  • Website structure changes frequently

  • Can block your server IP

  • Inaccurate sometimes

  • Legal / ToS risk

Still possible if you build it smartly:

  • rotate user-agent

  • caching

  • fallback sources

  • update every 1015 mins

Option C: Manual Admin Panel (Most stable, fastest to launch)

For GMP: add admin panel field:

  • GMP

  • Kostak

  • Sauda

  • UpdatedAt

Admin updates it daily.
Even big IPO websites do this.

Pros:

  • 100% stable

  • No scraping / API cost

  • Easy to implement

Cons:

  • Manual work

For OpenIPO this is actually the best initial approach:
Start manual later switch to API provider when traffic grows.

2) Subscription Data How to Get it

This one has a more official approach.

Best Source: NSE/BSE official subscription updates

Subscription details usually come from:

  • NSE IPO subscription page (live updates)

  • BSE subscription page

But again: there is no clean JSON API documented.

So options:

Option A: Scrape official NSE/BSE subscription tables

This is the most reliable, because its official.
You scrape:

  • Retail

  • NII

  • QIB

  • Employee

  • Total

  • Timestamp

Pros:

  • Official data

  • Highly trusted

  • Better than random sites

Cons:

  • HTML changes sometimes

  • Need cron refresh

Option B: Use third party IPO API provider

Some providers give subscription + GMP together.

Pros:

  • Easy

  • stable

Cons:

  • cost

Option C: Manual updates

Not recommended for subscription because it changes multiple times per day.

My Recommended Final Plan for OpenIPO (Best Mix)

For GMP:

Manual update via Admin panel (initially)

For Subscription:

NSE/BSE scraping + caching + cron update

This gives you:

  • High quality subscription data

  • Stable GMP data without spending money initially

How to Implement (Real Backend Plan)

A) Database fields to add

In your IpoSchema, add:

1) GMP section

js
gmp: {
  price: Number,
  kostak: Number,
  subjectToSauda: Number,
  updatedAt: Date,
  source: String
},

2) Subscription section

js
subscription: {
  retail: Number,
  nii: Number,
  qib: Number,
  employee: Number,
  total: Number,
  updatedAt: Date,
  source: String
},

B) Subscription fetching route (backend)

Create route:

GET /api/ipos/:slug/subscription/live

Backend:

  1. Check cached DB data updated within last 10 minutes

  2. If not, scrape NSE/BSE

  3. Store to MongoDB

  4. Return it

C) Cron Job to update subscription every 10 minutes

Use node-cron and update all Open IPOs.

Important: Why you cant find perfect API

GMP is unofficial market data (not exchange data)
Subscription is exchange data but not given as free JSON API

Thats why almost all IPO websites either:

  • use paid provider API, OR

  • scrape + cache, OR

  • manual GMP

If you want, I can now give you full working backend code for:
subscription scraper service
cron updater
MongoDB schema updates
API endpoints

And Ill keep it compatible with your stack (Node + Express + Mongo Atlas + Render).

Peer Comparison (Financial Performance) Company NAV/Share () RoNW (%) EPS (Basic) () ICICI Prudential Asset Management Co.Ltd 71.20 82.80 53.60 HDFC Asset Management Company Limited 189.80 32.40 57.60 Nippon Life India Asset Management Limited 66.40 31.40 20.30 UTI Asset Management Company Limited 359.40 16.30 57.40 Aditya Birla Sun Life AMC Limited 129.20 27.00 32.30 About Company ICICI Prudential AMC is one of Indias largest Asset Management Companies (AMCs) based on active Quarterly Average Assets Under Management (QAAUM). As of March 31, 2025, it managed a QAAUM of 8,794.1 billion. With over 30 years of experience, it is also one of the oldest AMCs in the Indian asset management industry. Beyond mutual funds, the company provides Portfolio Management Services (PMS), Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs), and offshore advisory services. Scale & Customer Reach The company serves 14.6 million customers and manages 135 mutual fund schemes across categories such as equity, debt, hybrid, Fund of Funds (FoFs), and others. Alternate Investment & Advisory Services ICICI Prudential AMC offers a diversified suite of investment and advisory solutions to both individual and institutional investors, including banks, insurance companies, corporates, and government bodies. As of March 31, 2025, its assets under advisory stood at 311.3 billion. Strength Market Leader in Active Mutual Fund Management: ICICI Prudential AMC is the largest asset management company in India in terms of active mutual fund QAAUM, holding a 13.3% market share as of March 31, 2025(Source: CRISIL Report). It also ranks second in overall QAAUM with a 13.0% market share. Strong Retail Investor Franchise: The company has the largest Individual Investor AUM in India, with 5,658.2 billion MAAUM and a 13.8% market share. Individual Investors contribute 62.2% of total mutual fund AUM and 86.4% of equity AUM, offering higher-fee income potential and a stable long-term asset base. Broad and Diversified Product Portfolio: ICICI Prudential AMC manages 135 mutual fund schemes, the highest among AMCs in India. Its AUM is well-diversified, with no single scheme contributing more than 7.1% of total QAAUM. This wide product suite enables the company to serve different investor profiles and maintain resilience across market cycles. Weakness Exposure to Market and Economic Volatility: A significant portion of revenue comes from management fees earned on mutual funds, PMS, AIFs, and advisory services. Any adverse economic or market conditionssuch as lower consumer savings, weak investor sentiment, or macroeconomic instabilitymay reduce AUM levels and consequently impact revenue, profitability, and cash flows. Risk of Investment Underperformance: If the companys investment products underperform their benchmarks or competing funds, AUM may decline due to investor withdrawals or lower inflows. Performance constraintsincluding market volatility and investment policy restrictionsmay also limit returns. Any sustained underperformance directly reduces management fees and negatively affects business and financial results. Intensifying Competition in the Asset Management Industry: The AMC sector faces competition from existing players, new entrants, and alternative investment options such as bank deposits, insurance products, gold, and real estate. Competitive pressures may lead to reduced market share, fee compression, and increased challenges in retaining investors and distribution partners, adversely affecting growth and profitability. async function run() {
  try {
    await mongoose.connect(process.env.MONGO_URI);
    console.log("MongoDB connected");

    //  upsert by slug (safe re-run)
    for (const doc of ipos) {
      await Ipo.updateOne({ slug: doc.slug }, { $set: doc }, { upsert: true });
      console.log("Upserted:", doc.slug);
    }

    console.log(" Seed completed");
    process.exit(0);
  } catch (err) {
    console.error(" Seed failed:", err);
    process.exit(1);
  }
}

run();

async function upsert(Model, query, data) {
  await Model.updateOne(query, { $set: data }, { upsert: true });
}

async function run() {
  try {
    await mongoose.connect(process.env.MONGO_URI);
    console.log(" MongoDB Connected");

    await upsert(Ipo, { slug }, ipo);
    await upsert(IpoDetails, { slug }, ipoDetails);
    await upsert(IpoFinancials, { slug }, ipoFinancials);
    await upsert(IpoGmp, { slug }, ipoGmp);
    await upsert(IpoReservation, { slug }, ipoReservation);
    await upsert(IpoSubscription, { slug }, ipoSubscription);

    console.log(" All seed data inserted/updated successfully!");
    process.exit(0);
  } catch (err) {
    console.error(" Seed failed:", err);
    process.exit(1);
  }
}

run();

node src/seed/icici.ipo.seed.js

env

You said:
there is need to modify my ipos database schema or add the anything
ChatGPT said:

Yes right now your schema is good for IPO Calendar + Basic IPO details
But for a premium IPO site like OpenIPO (GMP + Live subscription + Listing price + Live stock rate), you must add a few fields.

Otherwise you will face these problems:

  • You cant store live subscription history (only one snapshot)

  • You cant store listing performance (NSE/BSE listing price)

  • You cant store issue size in crore properly (your totalIssuePrice is string)

  • You cant store IPO status (Upcoming/Open/Closed/Listed) properly

  • You cant connect IPO to stock live price correctly

So answer:

Yes, schema modifications are needed
but only minimal changes (not big rewrite).

1) Changes needed in Ipo schema (Main collection)

Your current schema

js
totalIssuePrice: String
startDate: String
endDate: String

Recommended upgrade

Use Date format
Add status
Add numeric value for issue size
Add isActive for filtering

Updated Ipo Schema

js
startDate: Date,
endDate: Date,
allotmentDate: Date,
listingDate: Date,

status: {
  type: String,
  enum: ["UPCOMING", "OPEN", "CLOSED", "ALLOTMENT", "LISTED"],
  default: "UPCOMING"
},

issueSizeCr: Number,     // ex: 10602.65
totalIssuePrice: String, // keep old for display
isActive: { type: Boolean, default: true },

Why?

  • You can show Upcoming / Open / Closed IPO easily.

  • Date sorting becomes perfect.

  • Calendar view becomes accurate.

2) IpoSubscription schema improvements (Important!)

Right now you have:

js
updatedAtText: String,
subscriptions: [SubscriptionRowSchema]

This stores only one final data snapshot.

Problem

Subscription updates happen like:

  • Day 1: 5x

  • Day 2: 12x

  • Day 3: 35x final

If you want Live subscription chart you need history.

Upgrade schema for Subscription History

js
const SubscriptionSnapshotSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
  updatedAtText: String,
  updatedAtTime: Date,
  subscriptions: [SubscriptionRowSchema],
}, { _id: false });

const IpoSubscriptionSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
  ipoId: { type: Number, required: true, unique: true },
  slug: { type: String, required: true, index: true },

  source: String,

  //  latest snapshot
  latest: SubscriptionSnapshotSchema,

  //  history snapshots
  history: [SubscriptionSnapshotSchema]
}, { timestamps: true });

Now you can:

  • show latest subscription

  • show subscription trend chart

  • avoid losing data

3) IpoGmp schema upgrade (optional but recommended)

You already store gmpHistory, good

But add latest so frontend loads faster:

js
latest: {
  gmpDate: String,
  ipoPrice: Number,
  gmpPrice: Number,
  estimatedListingPrice: String,
  estimatedListingPercentage: String,
  lastUpdate: String,
}

Then backend keeps updating latest + push into gmpHistory.

4) Add New Collection: IpoListing (Required for your page)

Your UI shows:

NSE listing price
BSE listing price
Gain/Loss %
live stock rate

Currently you have no schema for this.

Create IpoListing schema (new file)

js
import mongoose from "mongoose";

const ListingPriceSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
  exchange: { type: String, enum: ["NSE", "BSE"] },
  listingPrice: Number,
  gain: Number,
  gainPct: Number,
}, { _id: false });

const LiveRateSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
  price: Number,
  change: Number,
  changePct: Number,
  open: Number,
  high: Number,
  low: Number,
  prevClose: Number,
  lowerCircuit: Number,
  upperCircuit: Number,
  high52w: Number,
  low52w: Number,
  pe: String,
  updatedAtText: String,
}, { _id: false });

const IpoListingSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
  ipoId: { type: Number, required: true, unique: true },
  slug: { type: String, required: true, index: true },

  listingPrices: [ListingPriceSchema],
  liveRate: LiveRateSchema,

  source: String
}, { timestamps: true });

export default mongoose.model("IpoListing", IpoListingSchema);

Now your page becomes complete.

5) Convert Date Strings into Date Type (Strongly recommended)

Because with string date:

  • sorting breaks

  • calendar issues

  • status logic becomes messy

So convert:
startDate, endDate, allotmentDate, listingDate Date

You SHOULD modify schema in these areas:

Ipo : add status, use Date, store issueSizeCr
IpoSubscription : store latest + history
Create new IpoListing collection

You do NOT need to modify:

IpoDetails (already good)
IpoFinancials (already good)
IpoReservation (already good)

I have implemented a secure, full-featured Admin Panel for OpenIPO with strong authentication, 2FA protection, and full IPO management tools.

  • IpoSubscription

    • Notes system

  • Date changes (Open/Close/Allotment/Listing)

# Existing
MONGO_URI=your_mongo_uri
JWT_SECRET=your_super_secret_jwt_key

ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@openipo.com
ADMIN_PASSWORD=securePassword123!

# Must be exactly 32 chars (AES-256 key)
ENCRYPTION_KEY=12345678901234567890123456789012

# Cookie settings
COOKIE_DOMAIN=localhost
NODE_ENV=development

Production Note

For production deployment:

  • NODE_ENV=production

  • HTTPS must be enabled

  • cookies must use Secure: true

Example:

env
COOKIE_DOMAIN=.openipo.in
NODE_ENV=production

bash
npm install
npm install otplib qrcode jsonwebtoken

If not already installed, you should also have:

bash
npm install bcrypt cookie-parser helmet express-rate-limit csurf

  • 2FA disabled initially (so you can log in and set it up)

/admin/login

  • email

  • password

/admin/setup-2fa

  • Scan the QR code

  • It will generate a 6-digit OTP code

Step 4: Verify OTP

Enter the OTP code to confirm setup.

Step 5: Save Backup Codes

After setup:
backup recovery codes will be shown only once

IMPORTANT: Save them immediately
(These are used if you lose your phone/authenticator.)

Step 6: Admin Dashboard

After successful 2FA:

You will be redirected to:

/admin/dashboard

4) IPO Management

/admin/ipos

  • View all IPOs

  • Delete IPO

HttpOnly Cookies

JWT token is stored in httpOnly cookies, so:

  • Not accessible to JavaScript

  • Protected from XSS token theft

2FA Enforcement

All Admin routes require:

  • Valid JWT

No bypass allowed.

Rate Limiting

Login & OTP endpoints protected against brute-force attacks.

Audit Logs Enabled

AdminAuditLog

7) Troubleshooting

  • Time sync issue

Cookies not saving in production?

  • Ensure HTTPS

  • Ensure correct COOKIE_DOMAIN

  • Ensure CORS includes your frontend origin

  • Ensure backend sends cookies with SameSite=None; Secure

1) seedAdmin.js (Full Code)

Create this file:

backend/src/seed/seedAdmin.js

js
import mongoose from "mongoose";
import dotenv from "dotenv";
import bcrypt from "bcrypt";

//  Update path if your folder structure differs
import Admin from "../models/Admin.js";

dotenv.config();

async function seedAdmin() {
  try {
    const { MONGO_URI, ADMIN_EMAIL, ADMIN_PASSWORD } = process.env;

    if (!MONGO_URI) {
      console.error(" MONGO_URI missing in .env");
      process.exit(1);
    }

    if (!ADMIN_EMAIL || !ADMIN_PASSWORD) {
      console.error(" ADMIN_EMAIL or ADMIN_PASSWORD missing in .env");
      console.log(" Add these in backend/.env:");
      console.log("ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@openipo.com");
      console.log("ADMIN_PASSWORD=StrongPassword123!");
      process.exit(1);
    }

    await mongoose.connect(MONGO_URI);
    console.log(" MongoDB connected");

    //  Check if admin already exists
    const existing = await Admin.findOne({ email: ADMIN_EMAIL.toLowerCase() });

    if (existing) {
      console.log(" Admin already exists:", existing.email);
      console.log(" Seed skipped (no changes made).");
      process.exit(0);
    }

    //  Hash password
    const saltRounds = 12;
    const passwordHash = await bcrypt.hash(ADMIN_PASSWORD, saltRounds);

    //  Create SUPER_ADMIN
    const admin = await Admin.create({
      email: ADMIN_EMAIL.toLowerCase(),
      passwordHash,
      role: "SUPER_ADMIN",
      isActive: true,

      //  2FA initially disabled (admin will enable it after login)
      twoFactorEnabled: false,
      twoFactorSecretEncrypted: null,
      twoFactorBackupCodes: [],
      twoFactorVerifiedAt: null,

      failedLoginCount: 0,
      lockUntil: null,
    });

    console.log(" SUPER_ADMIN created successfully!");
    console.log("Email:", admin.email);
    console.log("Role:", admin.role);
    console.log("2FA Enabled:", admin.twoFactorEnabled);

    process.exit(0);
  } catch (err) {
    console.error(" seedAdmin failed:", err.message);
    process.exit(1);
  }
}

seedAdmin();

3) Files (FULL CODE)

A) src/utils/encryption.js

js
import crypto from "crypto";

const ALGO = "aes-256-gcm";

// ENCRYPTION_KEY must be exactly 32 chars
function getKey() {
  const key = process.env.ENCRYPTION_KEY;
  if (!key || key.length !== 32) {
    throw new Error("ENCRYPTION_KEY must be exactly 32 characters");
  }
  return Buffer.from(key, "utf-8");
}

export function encryptText(plainText) {
  if (!plainText) return null;

  const iv = crypto.randomBytes(12);
  const key = getKey();

  const cipher = crypto.createCipheriv(ALGO, key, iv);
  const encrypted = Buffer.concat([cipher.update(plainText, "utf8"), cipher.final()]);
  const tag = cipher.getAuthTag();

  // iv:tag:ciphertext
  return `${iv.toString("hex")}:${tag.toString("hex")}:${encrypted.toString("hex")}`;
}

export function decryptText(payload) {
  if (!payload) return null;

  const [ivHex, tagHex, dataHex] = payload.split(":");
  const iv = Buffer.from(ivHex, "hex");
  const tag = Buffer.from(tagHex, "hex");
  const encrypted = Buffer.from(dataHex, "hex");
  const key = getKey();

  const decipher = crypto.createDecipheriv(ALGO, key, iv);
  decipher.setAuthTag(tag);

  const decrypted = Buffer.concat([decipher.update(encrypted), decipher.final()]);
  return decrypted.toString("utf8");
}

C) src/utils/auditLogger.js

import AdminAuditLog from "../models/AdminAuditLog.js";

export async function logAdminAction({ adminId, action, req, meta = {} }) {
  try {
    await AdminAuditLog.create({
      adminId: adminId || null,
      action,
      ip: req.headers["x-forwarded-for"]?.split(",")[0]?.trim() || req.socket?.remoteAddress || "",
      userAgent: req.headers["user-agent"] || "",
      meta,
    });
  } catch (err) {
    console.error("Audit log error:", err.message);
  }
}

D) src/middleware/adminAuth.middleware.js

js
import jwt from "jsonwebtoken";
import Admin from "../models/Admin.js";

export async function requireAdmin(req, res, next) {
  try {
    const token = req.cookies?.admin_token;
    if (!token) return res.status(401).json({ message: "Unauthorized" });

    const payload = jwt.verify(token, process.env.JWT_SECRET);

    const admin = await Admin.findById(payload.adminId).lean();
    if (!admin || !admin.isActive) {
      return res.status(401).json({ message: "Admin not found or inactive" });
    }

    //  enforce 2FA
    if (!admin.twoFactorEnabled || !admin.twoFactorVerifiedAt) {
      return res.status(401).json({ message: "2FA not verified" });
    }

    req.admin = admin;
    next();
  } catch (err) {
    return res.status(401).json({ message: "Unauthorized" });
  }
}

F) src/routes/admin.routes.js (Auth + 2FA + Notes)

Create file:

backend/src/routes/admin.routes.js

js
import express from "express";
import bcrypt from "bcrypt";
import jwt from "jsonwebtoken";
import { authenticator } from "otplib";
import QRCode from "qrcode";
import rateLimit from "express-rate-limit";

import Admin from "../models/Admin.js";
import IpoNote from "../models/IpoNote.js";
import { encryptText, decryptText } from "../utils/encryption.js";
import { logAdminAction } from "../utils/auditLogger.js";
import { requireAdmin } from "../middleware/adminAuth.middleware.js";

const router = express.Router();

//  Rate limit for login
const loginLimiter = rateLimit({
  windowMs: 10 * 60 * 1000,
  max: 10,
  standardHeaders: true,
  legacyHeaders: false,
});

// ---------------------------
// Helpers
// ---------------------------
function setAdminCookie(res, token) {
  const isProd = process.env.NODE_ENV === "production";
  res.cookie("admin_token", token, {
    httpOnly: true,
    secure: isProd,
    sameSite: isProd ? "none" : "lax",
    domain: process.env.COOKIE_DOMAIN || undefined,
    maxAge: 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000,
  });
}

function clearAdminCookie(res) {
  const isProd = process.env.NODE_ENV === "production";
  res.clearCookie("admin_token", {
    httpOnly: true,
    secure: isProd,
    sameSite: isProd ? "none" : "lax",
    domain: process.env.COOKIE_DOMAIN || undefined,
  });
}

// Generate backup codes
function generateBackupCodes(count = 10) {
  const codes = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    codes.push(
      Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 6).toUpperCase() +
        "-" +
        Math.random().toString(36).slice(2, 6).toUpperCase()
    );
  }
  return codes;
}

// ---------------------------
// Auth Routes
// ---------------------------

// 1) Email/Password login  return tempToken
router.post("/auth/login", loginLimiter, async (req, res) => {
  const { email, password } = req.body || {};
  if (!email || !password) return res.status(400).json({ message: "Email & password required" });

  const admin = await Admin.findOne({ email: email.toLowerCase() });
  if (!admin || !admin.isActive) {
    await logAdminAction({ adminId: null, action: "ADMIN_LOGIN_FAIL", req, meta: { email } });
    return res.status(401).json({ message: "Invalid credentials" });
  }

  // lock check
  if (admin.lockUntil && admin.lockUntil > new Date()) {
    return res.status(403).json({ message: "Account locked. Try later." });
  }

  const ok = await bcrypt.compare(password, admin.passwordHash);
  if (!ok) {
    admin.failedLoginCount = (admin.failedLoginCount || 0) + 1;

    // lock after 5 failures
    if (admin.failedLoginCount >= 5) {
      admin.lockUntil = new Date(Date.now() + 15 * 60 * 1000);
    }
    await admin.save();

    await logAdminAction({
      adminId: admin._id,
      action: "ADMIN_LOGIN_FAIL",
      req,
      meta: { email },
    });

    return res.status(401).json({ message: "Invalid credentials" });
  }

  // reset failure counters
  admin.failedLoginCount = 0;
  admin.lockUntil = null;
  await admin.save();

  const tempToken = jwt.sign(
    { adminId: admin._id.toString(), stage: "TEMP" },
    process.env.JWT_SECRET,
    { expiresIn: "5m" }
  );

  await logAdminAction({
    adminId: admin._id,
    action: "ADMIN_PASSWORD_OK_TEMP_ISSUED",
    req,
    meta: { email },
  });

  return res.json({
    tempToken,
    twoFactorEnabled: admin.twoFactorEnabled,
  });
});

// 2) Verify 2FA OTP  create session cookie
router.post("/auth/verify-2fa", async (req, res) => {
  const { tempToken, otp } = req.body || {};
  if (!tempToken || !otp) return res.status(400).json({ message: "tempToken & otp required" });

  try {
    const payload = jwt.verify(tempToken, process.env.JWT_SECRET);
    if (payload.stage !== "TEMP") return res.status(401).json({ message: "Invalid tempToken" });

    const admin = await Admin.findById(payload.adminId);
    if (!admin || !admin.isActive) return res.status(401).json({ message: "Unauthorized" });

    if (!admin.twoFactorEnabled || !admin.twoFactorSecretEncrypted) {
      return res.status(403).json({ message: "2FA is not enabled. Setup required." });
    }

    const secret = decryptText(admin.twoFactorSecretEncrypted);
    const isValid = authenticator.check(otp, secret);

    if (!isValid) {
      await logAdminAction({
        adminId: admin._id,
        action: "ADMIN_2FA_FAIL",
        req,
        meta: {},
      });
      return res.status(401).json({ message: "Invalid OTP" });
    }

    admin.twoFactorVerifiedAt = new Date();
    admin.lastLoginAt = new Date();
    admin.lastLoginIp =
      req.headers["x-forwarded-for"]?.split(",")[0]?.trim() || req.socket?.remoteAddress || "";

    await admin.save();

    const token = jwt.sign(
      { adminId: admin._id.toString(), role: admin.role },
      process.env.JWT_SECRET,
      { expiresIn: "7d" }
    );

    setAdminCookie(res, token);

    await logAdminAction({
      adminId: admin._id,
      action: "ADMIN_LOGIN_SUCCESS",
      req,
      meta: {},
    });

    return res.json({ message: "Login success" });
  } catch (err) {
    return res.status(401).json({ message: "Invalid temp token" });
  }
});

// logout
router.post("/auth/logout", async (req, res) => {
  clearAdminCookie(res);
  return res.json({ message: "Logged out" });
});

// me
router.get("/auth/me", requireAdmin, async (req, res) => {
  return res.json({
    admin: {
      id: req.admin._id,
      email: req.admin.email,
      role: req.admin.role,
    },
  });
});

// ---------------------------
// 2FA Setup Routes
// ---------------------------

// Setup QR
router.post("/2fa/setup", requireAdmin, async (req, res) => {
  const admin = await Admin.findById(req.admin._id);

  const secret = authenticator.generateSecret();
  const otpauth = authenticator.keyuri(admin.email, "OpenIPO Admin", secret);

  const qrDataUrl = await QRCode.toDataURL(otpauth);

  // store secret encrypted (not enabled yet)
  admin.twoFactorSecretEncrypted = encryptText(secret);
  await admin.save();

  await logAdminAction({
    adminId: admin._id,
    action: "ADMIN_2FA_SETUP_STARTED",
    req,
    meta: {},
  });

  return res.json({ qrDataUrl, otpauth });
});

// Confirm OTP & enable 2FA
router.post("/2fa/confirm", requireAdmin, async (req, res) => {
  const { otp } = req.body || {};
  if (!otp) return res.status(400).json({ message: "OTP required" });

  const admin = await Admin.findById(req.admin._id);
  if (!admin.twoFactorSecretEncrypted) return res.status(400).json({ message: "Setup not started" });

  const secret = decryptText(admin.twoFactorSecretEncrypted);
  const ok = authenticator.check(otp, secret);

  if (!ok) {
    await logAdminAction({
      adminId: admin._id,
      action: "ADMIN_2FA_CONFIRM_FAIL",
      req,
      meta: {},
    });
    return res.status(401).json({ message: "Invalid OTP" });
  }

  //  enable
  admin.twoFactorEnabled = true;
  admin.twoFactorVerifiedAt = new Date();

  //  backup codes
  const backupCodes = generateBackupCodes(10);
  const backupHashes = await Promise.all(backupCodes.map((c) => bcrypt.hash(c, 10)));
  admin.twoFactorBackupCodes = backupHashes;

  await admin.save();

  await logAdminAction({
    adminId: admin._id,
    action: "ADMIN_2FA_ENABLED",
    req,
    meta: {},
  });

  return res.json({
    message: "2FA enabled",
    backupCodes, //  shown once
  });
});

// Reset 2FA (password + otp)
router.post("/2fa/reset", requireAdmin, async (req, res) => {
  const { password, otp } = req.body || {};
  if (!password || !otp) return res.status(400).json({ message: "password & otp required" });

  const admin = await Admin.findById(req.admin._id);

  const okPwd = await bcrypt.compare(password, admin.passwordHash);
  if (!okPwd) return res.status(401).json({ message: "Invalid password" });

  if (!admin.twoFactorSecretEncrypted) return res.status(400).json({ message: "2FA not setup" });

  const secret = decryptText(admin.twoFactorSecretEncrypted);
  const okOtp = authenticator.check(otp, secret);

  if (!okOtp) return res.status(401).json({ message: "Invalid OTP" });

  admin.twoFactorEnabled = false;
  admin.twoFactorSecretEncrypted = null;
  admin.twoFactorBackupCodes = [];
  admin.twoFactorVerifiedAt = null;

  await admin.save();

  await logAdminAction({
    adminId: admin._id,
    action: "ADMIN_2FA_RESET",
    req,
    meta: {},
  });

  return res.json({ message: "2FA reset success" });
});

// ---------------------------
// Notes Routes
// ---------------------------

// Create/update note
router.post("/ipos/:slug/note", requireAdmin, async (req, res) => {
  const { slug } = req.params;
  const { ipoId, title, message, type } = req.body || {};

  if (!ipoId || !slug) return res.status(400).json({
You said:
[nodemon] starting node src/server.js file:///D:/openipo/backend/src/controllers/adminAuth.controller.js:3 import { authenticator } from 'otplib'; ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ SyntaxError: The requested module 'otplib' does not provide an export named 'authenticator' at #_instantiate (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:254:21) at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:105:5) at async ModuleJob.run (node:internal/modules/esm/module_job:369:5) at async onImport.tracePromise.__proto__ (node:internal/modules/esm/loader:691:26) at async asyncRunEntryPointWithESMLoader (node:internal/modules/run_main:101:5) Node.js v24.11.0 [nodemon] app crashed - waiting for file changes before starting... ChatGPT said:

Youre getting this error because your installed otplib version doesnt export authenticator as a named ESM export in the way your code is importing it.

This is a common issue in Node 20+ / Node 24 ESM.

Fix (100% working)

Replace this line:

js
import { authenticator } from "otplib";

With this:

js
import otplib from "otplib";

const { authenticator } = otplib;

Why this happens?

Some otplib builds export like:

  • default export = { authenticator, totp, hotp }

So named import fails in ESM:
{ authenticator }

But default import works:
otplib.authenticator

Apply Fix in your file

In:

src/controllers/adminAuth.controller.js

At top:

js
import otplib from "otplib";
const { authenticator } = otplib;

Then your usage remains same:

js
const secret = authenticator.generateSecret();
const isValid = authenticator.check(token, secret);

File: src/models/Ipo.js

  default: "UPCOMING"

js
import mongoose from "mongoose";

const ipoSchema = new mongoose.Schema(
  {
    ipoId: { type: Number, unique: true, required: true },
    slug: { type: String, unique: true, required: true },

    companyName: { type: String, required: true, index: true },
    companyLogo: String,

    type: { type: String, enum: ["MAINBOARD", "SME"], required: true },
    exchanged: { type: String, enum: ["BOTH", "NSE", "BSE"], default: "BOTH" },
    issueType: { type: String, enum: ["IPO", "FPO"], default: "IPO" },

    startDate: String,
    endDate: String,
    allotmentDate: String,
    listingDate: String,

    status: {
      type: String,
      enum: ["UPCOMING", "OPEN", "CLOSED", "ALLOTMENT", "LISTED"],
      default: "UPCOMING"
    },

    lotSize: Number,
    minimumPrice: Number,
    maximumPrice: Number,

    totalIssuePrice: String,

    //  NEW
    issueSizeCr: Number,
    issueSizeShares: Number,

    minInvestment: Number, // maxPrice * lotSize
    symbol: String
  },
  { timestamps: true }
);

export default mongoose.model("Ipo", ipoSchema);

import mongoose from "mongoose";

const LotRowSchema = new mongoose.Schema(
  {
    category: String,      // Retail(min), Retail(max), SHNI(min)...
    lots: Number,
    shares: Number,
    amount: Number
  },
  { _id: false }
);

const IpoLotSchema = new mongoose.Schema(
  {
    ipoId: { type: Number, required: true, unique: true },
    slug: { type: String, required: true, index: true },

    lots: [LotRowSchema]
  },
  { timestamps: true }
);

export default mongoose.model("IpoLot", IpoLotSchema);

const IpoFullSchema = new mongoose.Schema({
  ipoId: Number,
  slug: String,

  basic: {
    companyName: String,
    companyLogo: String,
    type: String,
    exchanged: String,
    issueType: String,

    startDate: String,
    endDate: String,
    allotmentDate: String,
    listingDate: String,

    lotSize: Number,
    minimumPrice: Number,
    maximumPrice: Number,

    issueSizeCr: Number,
    issueSizeShares: Number,
    symbol: String
  },

  issueDetails: {
    faceValue: Number,
    freshIssueShares: Number,
    freshIssuePrice: String,
    ofsIssueShares: Number,
    ofsIssuePrice: String,
    totalIssueShares: Number,
    totalIssuePrice: String,
    listingAt: [String],

    registrar: {},
    leadManagers: []
  },

  subscription: {
    updatedAtText: String,
    byCategory: []
  },

  gmp: {
    current: Number,
    lastUpdate: String,
    history: []
  },

  reservation: [],

  lots: [],

  valuations: {},

  promoters: {},

  peers: [],

  financials: {
    kpis: [],
    rows: []
  },

  documents: {},

  note: {
    isActive: Boolean,
    title: String,
    message: String,
    type: String
  }
}, { timestamps: true });

Changes I Recommend (Minimal)

1) Add a version + source metadata in IpoFull

Why?

After migration, youll want to know:

  • which IPO docs are migrated vs newly created

  • whether a doc is outdated

  • schemaVersion: Number

  • dataSource: String

  • lastSyncedAt: Date

  • migratedFromOld: Boolean

js
schemaVersion: { type: Number, default: 1 },
dataSource: { type: String, default: "ADMIN" }, // ADMIN | MIGRATION | API
lastSyncedAt: Date,
migratedFromOld: { type: Boolean, default: false },

2) Require strict validation on create/update

Why?

In single model, one bad request can corrupt the whole IPO doc.

Plan improvement:

  • Use zod/joi schema validation in admin create/update

  • runValidators: true in mongoose update

Example in controller:

js
await IpoFull.findOneAndUpdate({ slug }, { $set: payload }, { new: true, runValidators: true });

3) Add unique constraints + compound indexes

Why?

You already said unique indexed (good). Add compound indexes too.

Add indexes:

  • { "basic.type": 1, "basic.startDate": 1 }

  • { "basic.status": 1, "basic.listingDate": 1 }

This makes calendar & filters fast.

4) Migration script MUST support missing pieces

Why?

Old collections may not always exist for every IPO.
Ex: Some IPO may have Ipo only, no IpoDetails.

Plan update:
Migration must:

  • merge safely using defaults

  • handle missing docs gracefully

  • log missing parts per slug

5) Keep old APIs temporarily (Optional but recommended)

Why?

Frontend will break if it still hits old endpoints.

Suggested:

  • keep old endpoints for 12 weeks (deprecated)

  • internally they can read from IpoFull or show warning

Not required, but helps you avoid site down while refactoring frontend.

6) Admin auth middleware should allow access even if 2FA not setup (only for setup routes)

Why?

Otherwise setup route can get blocked.

middleware:

  • requireAdmin strict for normal routes

  • requireAdminBasic for setup routes

  1. add schemaVersion and migration metadata

3) Replace server.js with V2-only version (MOST IMPORTANT)

backend/src/server.js (FINAL CLEAN VERSION)

js
import express from "express";
import cors from "cors";
import cookieParser from "cookie-parser";
import helmet from "helmet";
import rateLimit from "express-rate-limit";
import dotenv from "dotenv";

import connectDB from "./config/db.js";
import v2PublicIpoRoutes from "./routes/v2/publicIpo.routes.js";
import v2AdminIpoRoutes from "./routes/v2/adminIpo.routes.js";

import { notFound } from "./middlewares/notFound.js";
import { errorHandler } from "./middlewares/errorHandler.js";

dotenv.config();

const app = express();

//  Security + parsing
app.use(helmet());
app.use(express.json({ limit: "1mb" }));
app.use(cookieParser());

//  CORS
app.use(
  cors({
    origin: process.env.CORS_ORIGIN,
    credentials: true,
  })
);

//  Rate limit
app.use(
  rateLimit({
    windowMs: 10 * 60 * 1000,
    max: 300,
    standardHeaders: true,
    legacyHeaders: false,
  })
);

//  Base route (health)
app.get("/", (req, res) => {
  res.json({ success: true, message: "OpenIPO V2 backend running" });
});

//  V2 routes ONLY
app.use("/api/v2/ipos", v2PublicIpoRoutes);
app.use("/api/v2/admin/ipos", v2AdminIpoRoutes);

//  404 & Error handling
app.use(notFound);
app.use(errorHandler);

const PORT = process.env.PORT || 5000;

connectDB()
  .then(() => {
    app.listen(PORT, () => {
      console.log(` OpenIPO V2 backend running on port ${PORT}`);
    });
  })
  .catch((err) => {
    console.error(" DB connection failed:", err.message);
    process.exit(1);
  });

4) Add notFound.js and errorHandler.js (clean debugging)

src/middlewares/notFound.js

js
export function notFound(req, res, next) {
  res.status(404).json({
    success: false,
    message: `Route not found: ${req.method} ${req.originalUrl}`,
  });
}

src/middlewares/errorHandler.js

js
export function errorHandler(err, req, res, next) {
  console.error(" Error:", err);

  const statusCode = res.statusCode !== 200 ? res.statusCode : 500;

  res.status(statusCode).json({
    success: false,
    message: err.message || "Server Error",
  });
}

These 2 files alone make debugging 10x easier.

5) Clean package.json scripts (helps debug)

backend/package.json

json
{
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "nodemon src/server.js",
    "start": "node src/server.js",
    "seed:v2": "node src/seed/seedShadowfaxV2.js"
  }
}

This avoids accidental deletion in production.

    • updatedBy

Shadowfax Technologies Company Financials In Cr. About Shadowfax Technologies Company Founded in 2015 , Shadowfax is a leading logistics and delivery service provider based in Bangalore, India. The company offers a comprehensive range of services, including rapid parcel delivery, same-day and next-day delivery, doorstep-to-doorstep exchange, and Quick Commerce with 10-minute delivery times. Shadowfax has established a strong presence in the logistics sector, covering over 18,000 pin codes across more than 2,500 cities. With an impressive capacity of delivering over two million packages daily, the company is renowned for its swift service, often delivering packages within 30 to 60 minutes of order placement. This rapid delivery capability is becoming increasingly common in India.
